value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shiny slab of mud beneath the warehouses; & <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-stpa" key="St Paul's Cathedral">St Pauls</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rises. The gulls are swooping; & some small boys</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">paddle in the pebbles. Above the sky is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">huddled & crowded with purple streamers.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">We are still thinking of the plays, because</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">it was here that the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-glob" key="Globe, The">Globe</rs> stood. Now let us</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">give way to the imagination. <del>After all</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>what are four hundred years.</del> <del>We can</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>What</del> The roar & the chaos; the [friend?] of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">which; the general diffusion: all</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">soon breed a great device for statement.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Such was one of the elements in the drama.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Another, <del>the language.</del> <del>In</del> Here is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">unwritten poem. In this disorder, this sound,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the difficulty of keeping away from the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">statement. A roar, a general incoherence.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the presence of light, & [sentences?]; some</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">saying: an attitude. In us</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">leaving over the river, long one way in some</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">alley; there rises the curious nameless</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>drive</del> <del>to express</del> – <del>but less</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The <del>more heightened the more need of</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>poetry</del> <del>Who is there</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>If</del> It is equally important, to the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">understanding of the poem, <del>to</del> not to read at all.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to dip, now & again into the inchoate</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& to talk, with many [illeg.], much</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">felt art.</l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l>This is particularly true today; when </l>
            <l>the [economic?] force is cutting the critic into</l>
            <l>a special force.</l>
          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">For then we revive the reader – a very</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">impatient person. <del>The</del> For the reader was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">born when the playhouse closed.</l>
